N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 158.1 - General

State Regulations
(a) Section
380-a
of the Vehicle and Traffic Law provides that it shall be unlawful to operate on
any public highway any open truck or trailer being utilized for the
transportation of earth, sand, stone or similar loose substances, unless said
truck or trailer has a cover, tarpaulin or other device of a type and
specification approved by the Commissioner of Transportation which completely
closes in the opening on the said truck or trailer while said truck or trailer
shall be so operated, so as to prevent the falling of any such substances
therefrom. It also authorizes the commissioner to apply these provisions to
specific conditions and loads. (b) Section 380-a specifically provides that if the load is six inches below the
top of the sides of such truck or trailer, the covering is not
necessary. (c) Section 380-a
specifically exempts motor vehicles, trailers and semitrailers conveying "farm
products" as defined in section
2
of
the Agriculture and Markets Law from its requirements. (d) For purposes of this Part, if any portion
of the load, as measured laterally, is found to be above six inches below the
sides of the truck transporting the load, such load shall be covered as
provided in this Part. (e) The
commissioner hereby approves any cover, tarpaulin or other device, and the use
thereof, which conforms with sections
158.2
and
158.3
of this Part. Notes
